title: Ethereum Could Explode by Up to 1,556% in an AI-Powered Economy, Says Arthur Hayes – Here’s the Timeline - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

BitMEX co-founder Arthur Hayes predicts Ethereum could surge up to 1,556% as AI-powered DAOs issue tokens on decentralized exchanges (DEXs). Hayes believes DEXs will see more trading volume than traditional centralized exchanges (CEXs) as DAOs capture economic value. Ethereum could reach a five-figure price within half a decade, with Hayes aiming to profit from the shift in market narrative.

title: How Many Ethereum (ETH) Addresses Show Real Activity? You Would Be Surprised - U.Today
summary: In a recent analysis of Ethereum (ETH) addresses, it was found that only 4.5-7 million of the 27 million new wallets created in the past year authorize at least one transaction per month. Additionally, 70% of these wallets are dropped after 30 days of activity. The majority of Ethereum (ETH) addresses show low activity, with 66% only active for one day and 95.5% active for less than 10 distinct days within the last year. However, a small number of wallets show sustainable activity, with 1.9 million wallets active for over 10 days in the last year. The report suggests that many of these low-activity wallets are likely created by "airdrop hunters" using sophisticated software to manipulate retroactive airdrops.

title: BitMEX Co-Founder Arthur Hayes Predicts Ethereum Could Surge 1,556% To $31,063 - Zenger.News
summary: BitMEX co-founder Arthur Hayes predicts Ethereum could surge 1,556% to $31,063, driven by AI technology and decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs). Hayes believes DAOs will issue tokens on-chain, which will trade on decentralized exchanges (DEXs) built on Ethereum, leading to increased activity and a five-figure price for Ethereum within half a decade. At the time of writing, ETH is trading at $1,874.33, down 1% in the last week.

title: Shiba Inu price along with BONE rally as Shibarium-Ethereum bridge testnet kicks off - FXStreet
summary: Shiba Inu and Bone ShibaSwap prices surged by 5% and 8%, respectively, in the last 24 hours. The increase was driven by the launch of the Shibarium-Ethereum bridge testnet, which could potentially increase the use case of BONE and SHIB. However, the network growth has been declining, with a 44% drop in new addresses formed in the past week. The Shiba Inu price is on the verge of being overbought, and a quicker recovery is necessary to revive investor interest and prevent any significant drawdown.

title: Crypto Prices Today: Bitcoin, Ethereum, MATIC, Check Prices of Major Cryptocurrencies On July 28 - News18
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Crypto prices today are down due to weakening buying strength, with the US Federal Reserve's interest rate hike and higher-than-expected US GDP raising concerns about prolonged high rates. Bitcoin is trading lower by 0.98%, while Ethereum and Ripple are up by 0.13% and 0.29%, respectively. Other major cryptocurrencies are also down, with Polygon and Cardano down by 2.43% and 2.43%, respectively. The global crypto market capitalization is at $1.23 trillion, and the fear and greed index is at 52/100, remaining in the neutral zone.

title: This Week in Coins: Weak Week for Bitcoin and Ethereum—and Worldcoin - Decrypt
summary: This week in coins, Worldcoin, a new cryptocurrency, launched with controversial biometric verification requirements. The market leaders, Bitcoin and Ethereum, had a lackluster week with little price movement. Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a bill granting legal tender to a digital ruble, while South Korea established a new unit to tackle crypto crime. In the US, Democrats and Republicans disagreed on a bill aimed at promoting financial innovation, with Democrats expressing concerns about weak consumer protections. XRP and Toncoin were the only other notable movers, with XRP experiencing a recent growth spurt and Toncoin falling 15%.

title: Ethereum Classic Price Prediction: Will ETC Price Reach $25? - The Coin Republic
summary: Ethereum Classic (ETC) price may reach $25 in the long term, according to price prediction. The cryptocurrency has shown bullish trend reversal and recovered 23% from recent swing low. The price is currently stuck in a narrow range between $17 and $22, and if buyers defend the lower range, a short-term bounce is possible. The MACD curve is reversing upward and the RSI is at 48, indicating mild bullishness. However, the price faces resistance at $21 and $24, and support at $17 and $15. Investing in or trading crypto assets comes with a risk of financial loss.

title: More Investors Backing Ethereum, Will QUBE and ERC-20 Tokens Rip Higher? - CoinChapter
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

InQubeta, an Ethereum-based project, has generated over $1.8 million in tokens during its presale, with investors standing to gain up to 300% returns. Ethereum has seen a significant increase in investor backing in 2023, with prices rising by up to 70%. InQubeta and other ERC-20 tokens are boosting Ethereum trading volume by creating an alternative way to invest in AI startups. The InQubeta ecosystem solves two real-world problems by opening up investment opportunities in AI and directing more capital to AI firms. The AI revolution is expected to generate exponential profits for investors, and InQubeta makes such investments more accessible. Ethereum continues to generate investor interest due to its improved functionality and the success of Ethereum-based projects like InQubeta, Chainlink, and Polygon. InQubeta is projected to enjoy up to 100x growth after its launch.
